channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-1453] Parse error into GeoJsonPoint if coordinates are "integers"
item.description:
When mapping a document containing a GeoJSON location into a GeoJsonPoint object, if the location coordinates are "round" numbers (e.g. [0,0]) I get a ClassCastException: 

Failed to convert from type \[com.mongodb.BasicDBObject\] to type \[org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.geo.GeoJsonPoint\] for value '\{ "type" : "Point" , "coordinates" : [ 0 , 0]\}'; nested exception is java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to java.lang.Double
item.summary: Parse error into GeoJsonPoint if coordinates are "integers"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
good catch - seems to happen when data is inserted not using Spring Data and the GeoJson types in first place.

this one passes:

WithGeoJson wgj = new WithGeoJson();
 
wgj.id = "1";
 
wgj.description = "datamongo-1453";
 
wgj.point = new GeoJsonPoint(0, 0);
 
 
 
template.save(wgj);
 
 
 
assertThat(template.findOne(query(where("id").is(wgj.id)), WithGeoJson.class).point, is(equalTo(wgj.point)));

this one fails:

BasicDBObject point = new BasicDBObject();
 
point.put("type", "Point");
 
point.put("coordinates", new BasicDbListBuilder().add(0).add(0).get());
 
 
 
BasicDBObject outer = new BasicDBObject();
 
outer.append("_id", "datamongo-1453");
 
outer.append("description", "datamongo-1453");
 
outer.append("point", point);
 
 
 
this.factory.getDb().getCollection("withGeoJson").insert(outer);
 
 
 
assertThat(template.findOne(query(where("id").is("datamongo-1453")), WithGeoJson.class).point, is(equalTo(wgj.point)));

will fix that!

In my case, I'm using a Repository Query (ignore the first one):

public interface TourActivityInfoRepository extends Repository<TourActivityInfoDoc, Long> {
 
	
	@Query(value = "{'categoryAnd.typeList.code' : {$in: ?0}}")
 
	public List<TourActivityInfoDoc> findByTypeIn(List<String> type);
 
	
	@Query(value = "{'location' : {'$geoWithin' : {'$box' : ?0}}}")
 
	public List<TourActivityInfoDoc> findByLocationWithin(Box box);
 
	
	@Query(value = "{'categoryAnd.typeList.code' : {$in: ?0}, 'location' : {'$geoWithin' : {'$box' : ?1}}}")
 
	public List<TourActivityInfoDoc> findByByTypeInAndLocationWithin(List<String> type, Box box);
 
}

The TourActivityInfoDoc class being something like:

@Document(collection="TourActivityInfo")
 
public class TourActivityInfoDoc implements Serializable {
 
 
 
	@Id
 
	private String id;
 
	
	private String description;
 
		
	private GeoJsonPoint location;
 
 
 
        // Getters, setters, etc.
 
        ...
 
}
@Javier Caselli I've just pushed some changes to issue/DATAMONGO-1453 would you mind giving the 1.10.0.DATAMONGO-1453-SNAPSHOT a try. It's already available via https://repo.spring.io.
@cstrobl Awesome, I'll give it a shot ASAP and get back to you guys!
@Christoph Strobl That did the magic, now it maps the coordinates even if they're integer numbers. Thanks!
